{"id":1523557220,"question_id":2764,"lang":"python3","lang_name":"Python3","time":"1 month, 1 week","timestamp":1738087285,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"78 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/1523557220/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Maximum Number of Fish in a Grid","memory":"18.1 MB","code":"class Solution:\n    def findMaxFish(self, grid: List[List[int]]) -> int:\n        ROWS,COLS=len(grid),len(grid[0])\n        res=0\n        visit=set()\n\n\n        def dfs(r,c):\n            if r<0 or c<0 or r==ROWS or c==COLS or grid[r][c]==0 or (r,c) in visit:\n                return 0\n\n            visit.add((r,c))\n            res=grid[r][c]\n            neighbor=[[r+1,c],[r-1,c],[r,c-1],[r,c+1]]\n            for nr,nc in neighbor:\n                res+=dfs(nr,nc)\n            \n            return res\n\n        for r in range(ROWS):\n            for c in range(COLS):\n                res=max(res,dfs(r,c))\n        \n        return res","compare_result":"","title_slug":"maximum-number-of-fish-in-a-grid","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
